result.execSummary:
The defendant Grace M. Desforge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**4 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: With case 22CF281.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Must enroll in and successfully complete Treatment Court. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant must complete credits at Charter McKinnley School to obtain HSED or equivalent. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with Officer Tyler VanReese outside of official capacity.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachments
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.
*See Plea Hearing docket.*

(8:59 AM cases 22CF281, 22CF473 called.) Defendant Grace M. Desforge in court, in custody. Attorney Melissa M. Petersen and Attorney William Schembera in court for Grace M. Desforge. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 22CF281, 22CF473 and Court accepts waivers.
State will file an Information in both cases which will mirror the criminal complaints.
Defendant is ready to proceed without the Information on file but understands the Information will be filed.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF281 Count 1: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer as Repeater and 22CF473 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF281 Count 1 and 22CF473 Count 1.
Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
Must enroll in and successfully complete Treatment Court. 9 months jail, stayed pending further order of the Court on 22CF281 Count 1 and 22CF473 Count 1. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. No contact with Officer Tyler VanReese outside of official capacity. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Defendant must complete credits at Charter McKinnley School to obtain HSED or equivalent. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 3 days credit in 22CF281 and 4 days credit in 22CF473. Any remaining charges including case 22FO407 are dismissed and read in.
Same as Complaint.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
